JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Dean Spielmann;Elisabeth Steiner;Giorgio Malinverni;Khanlar Hajiyev;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by PERSON , former Representative of GPE at ORG .
The local police organised an undercover drug purchase operation targeting the applicant , who was suspected of involvement in drug dealing .

On DATE a plain clothes police officer came to the applicant ’s flat and asked if he could purchase opium . The applicant allegedly agreed and asked for MONEY ( RUB ) for a sachet of opium . The police officer presented the applicant with RUB CARDINAL in marked bills , took the sachet and went down to a lower landing in the building where he handed the sachet with the opium to the other police officers in the presence of CARDINAL attesting witnesses PERSON , PERSON , and Ya . The police officers and the said witnesses went to the applicant ’s flat . The police conducted a search and found the marked bills and more opium . The applicant was arrested and detained pending investigation and trial .

On DATE the investigator dismissed the applicant ’s lawyer request for a dactylographic expert examination of the banknotes found at the applicant ’s flat . In particular , the investigator indicated as follows :
“ The fact that [ the applicant ] was guilty of selling QUANTITY of opium to L. has been fully and objectively proven by the [ evidence collected ] . ”

During the trial the applicant maintained his innocence , alleging that the police had set him up . According to him , on DATE an acquaintance , PERSON , came to his flat to see his wife . As his wife was not home , PERSON left . The applicant was about to close the door after her when several policemen burst into the flat . CARDINAL of them handcuffed him . Another CARDINAL put CARDINAL - rouble bills on the cupboard . When the police checked them , they turned out to be marked . Then another policeman “ found ” opium in the breadbin . The opium was shown to PERSON , PERSON and GPE . , the QUANTITY witnesses who had come with the police .

The court granted the prosecutor ’s request to read out the records of the testimonies given by PERSON , PERSON and Ya in the course of the investigation . The court overruled the applicant ’s objection , noting that those persons did not live at the addresses they had indicated and that their current whereabouts were unknown to the authorities .
On DATE the ORG of GPE found the applicant guilty of drug dealing and sentenced him to DATE imprisonment .

The court based its findings on the following evidence : testimonies given in court by CARDINAL policemen who had been involved in the undercover drug purchase , the applicant ’s arrest and the search of his flat ; records of the testimonies given by PERSON , PERSON and GPE . , who had been questioned in course of the criminal investigation and confirmed the policemen ’s account of the events of QUANTITY DATE ; records concerning the organisation of the undercover operation by the police , including the marking of the money bills , photocopies of the bills , and the report on the search of the applicant ’s flat ; and reports on forensic examination of the money bills , opium , and wipe samples from the applicant ’s hands .

The court also heard evidence from PERSON , who confirmed the applicant ’s version of the events . The court , however , found her testimony unreliable , having regard to the fact that she was a friend of the applicant ’s wife .

The applicant appealed . He complained , inter alia , that the money bills had not been subject to fingerprint examination and that he had not had the opportunity to confront witnesses PERSON , PERSON and Ya .

On DATE the Rostov ORG upheld the applicant ’s conviction on appeal . As regards the fingerprint examination requested by the applicant , the court noted that it could not be performed because the bills had already been subjected to a series of other expert examinations that would render the results unreliable . As for the trial court ’s failure to obtain the attendance of CARDINAL witnesses , the court noted that the witnesses could not be found at the addresses they had indicated .

On DATE the Pervomaiskiy District Court of Rostov - on - Don reviewed the applicant ’s conviction to take account of recent amendments to LAW and reduced his sentence to DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment .
On DATE the Presidium of the Rostov ORG reclassified the charges against the applicant and reduced his sentence to DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment .

On DATE the Deputy General Prosecutor of GPE asked ORG of GPE for the supervisory review of the applicant ’s conviction . The prosecutor argued , inter alia , that the trial court had failed to duly obtain the attendance of witnesses PERSON , PERSON , and Ya .

On DATE the Presidium of ORG of the Russian Federation quashed the judgments of DATE and DATE by way of supervisory review and remitted the matter for fresh consideration . As regards the trial court ’s use of the statements made by PERSON , PERSON and PERSON . ORG acknowledged that the trial court ’s failure to obtain the ORG attendance amounted to a violation of the applicant ’s right set out in LAW ) . ORG noted that the authorities’ attempts to find the missing witnesses had not been satisfactory . According to ORG findings , all CARDINAL witnesses had been students at the material time and had been residing in GPE temporarily . They had also provided the police with the addresses of their permanent residence . However , the trial court had kept on serving process on them at their old temporary addresses , and no attempt had been made to locate them at the permanent addresses they had indicated .

On an unspecified date the ORG of GPE opened a new trial . The court requested the bailiffs to obtain the attendance of witnesses PERSON , PERSON and Ya . by serving process on them at their permanent residence .
On DATE a bailiff in the town of FAC certified that witness B. could not be found at the address he had indicated and that his whereabouts were unknown .

On CARDINAL DATE a bailiff in GPE certified that witness Ya . could not be found at his permanent place of residence . According to Ya . ’s family , he had been working abroad since DATE and they did not know when he was coming back .

On DATE the ORG of GPE found the applicant guilty of drug dealing and sentenced him to DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment . The court based its findings , as before , on the testimonies of the police officers and witnesses PERSON , PERSON and GPE . , records concerning the undercover operation , as well as forensic evidence . Witness PERSON testified in court , while witnesses PERSON and Ya . could not attend . The court read out statements obtained from them in the course of the investigation .

Both the applicant and the prosecutor appealed . The applicant maintained his innocence , claiming that the trial court had based its findings on contradictory evidence ; that the investigator had failed to inform him of the decisions to commission forensic expert reports ; that the trial court had failed to promptly examine PERSON , who had later died and been unable to testify on his behalf .
On DATE ORG upheld the applicant ’s conviction on appeal dismissing the applicant ’s arguments as unsubstantiated .
